Entering crypto due to popular demand

As more and more financial companies and institutions venture into the crypto market due to customer demand, there’s an increasingly greater need for understanding the regulations surrounding this asset class to mitigate financial risks, ensure protection against fraud and cybercrime and, along with that, to comply with regulatory requirements.

Misconception exists that cryptocurrency is lightly or unregulated, but this is not accurate. Though the rules for activities in crypto are in many cases the same as for traditional assets, the nature of cryptocurrency adds additional layers of complexity. But what are the exact regulatory requirements of your region, how often do they change and what measures the companies need to take to set up the appropriate operational frameworks to become and maintain compliance?

The challenges of setting up a crypto solution for your clients

To give you a better understanding of what it takes to start offering crypto to your clients, we have, through the prism of the constantly evolving cryptocurrency regulatory landscape, highlighted the core components of a successful crypto compliance program:

  • Transaction monitoring and blockchain forensics
  • Anti-Money Laundering (AML) with Know Your Customer (KYC) processes
  • Sanctions and counter-terrorism measures
  • Cybersecurity
  • The Travel Rule
  • Anti-market manipulation measures
  • Consumer protection and offering continuous education

All of these need to be finetuned to jurisdiction-specific regulations around the globe. Various market participants entering the crypto space may manage the demands independently with their own resources or need varying levels of support and expertise.

The cryptocurrency regulation is intricate and constantly changing by jurisdiction. Our experts can assist in staying current with regulatory and market changes to maintain a compliant infrastructure.
